Permissions over storage are needed in order to run this task Yes No Autofirma App Import certificate Please, select the file to sign Welcome to Autofirma App This application allows making electronic signatures from compatible service providers Web pages.\n\nTo use the app, you\'ll need an electronic certificate and its related private key installed on the device. Consult the Android documentation and your service provider\'s documentation. Use asterisk (*) at the beginning or end as wildcard. Enter your CAN code to establish an NFC connection with your DNIe. The CAN code contains six digits and can be found in the lower right corner of your DNI Menu Close Home List of three elements PDF password. The document is password protected Protected document Easy and secure signing Sign documents enclosed and legally identifying you with your digital certificate or electonic ID. Start Begin Continue Understood Add new certificate Add certificate Cancel Locate the file Locate .p12 or .pfx file. on your phone Send to device If you can\'t find it, send it to your mobile from another device via email or other cloud applications. We couldn\'t add your certificate We haven\'t been able to add your certificate to the Autofirma app correctly. Try again later Try again Signed file The file has been signed correctly. How will you sign? What will you identify with? Electronic certificate Electronic ID What is Autofirma for? This application enables electronic signatures to be made on the pages of service providers supporting it. To work properly, you must install an electronic certificate. Check your Android system documentation and with your certification service provider. How to install certificates? Load your certificate on your device or in the cloud. Impair it through the "Add Certificate" option of the application. Allowed extensions: .p12 and .pfx. Remember that you need the export password for your certificate, and that it must include the private key. More information MY SETTINGS Language Sign configuration HELP FAQ How to install certificates GENERAL INFORMATION Legal notice Version v%s How can I make electronic signatures with this program?

Autofirma App allows you to sign with certified web formalities compatible with the application. To sign a paperwork, please complete it normally through your web browser. If the procedure is ready for signature with Autofirma App, it will be executed at the time of signature, will allow the user to select the signing certificate and run the operation.

There is also the possibility of opening the application and signing a file directly for personal use. A signature will be added to the PDF documents, while for the other files a separate signature file will be generated.

Remember that in order to be able to sign before you must have imported your signature certificate on Android.

The signing of some web formalities with Autofirma App fails, while in those same procedures it works on other devices. Why? Autofirma App still lacks certain features that are present in versions for other operating systems. Future app updates will address these shortcomings. In the meantime, use a PC with Autofirma installed to complete the web process and notify the person responsible for the procedure if it deems it necessary. Are my certificates at risk if I lose the device? The certificates are stored on your device with powerful encryption, but like any cryptographic system, at the time it is out of control of the owner is at risk of being compromised. If you lose the device you should contact your certification service provider as soon as possible to immediately revoke the certificates it contained. "Autofirma App" v.%s 2025 Government of Spain Autofirma App is Free Software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the following license: "European Software License 1.1", Curyo full text can be found on the following website: The source code of this program, as well as of the other project components, can be freely downloaded from: The Autofirma App project is a collaborative project, if you want to participate in it, feel free to join the community, accessible from the following website: https://eupl.eu/1.1/es http://forja-ctt.administracionelectronica.gob.es https://administracionelectronica.gob.es/ctt/clienteafirma/mas#.Xxp7T0I7mhc Acceptance of legal texts I have read and agree to the Privacy Policy I have read and agree with the Legal Notice and the Terms and Conditions of Use Identification with DNIe To identify yourself using DNIe, you need to have an electronic ID with certificates in effect and know the PIN code. Is my ID compatible? The DNIe supported by this process are DNI 3.0 y 4.0. If you have any questions about what your own is, you can see it at the following link: Electronic ID portal. National Police Corps https://www.dnielectronico.es/PortalDNIe/ Enter the CAN of the DNI The CAN is a number located at the bottom right of the ID. It is necessary for ID reading with NFC. Enter the PIN When you get the DNIe you received a PIN code that you can retrieve or change in police stations without appointment. Enter your ID CAN code Enter your PIN code Read your DNIe with mobile Place your DNIe on a smooth surface and place your mobile without cover on it until it detects the chip. Read DNIe Step %s of 3 Searching DNIe Place your mobile over the DNIe as close as possible to the NFC reader. Unselected certificate No certificate installed in the system has been found or not selected to make the signature. Espa\u00F1ol English Français Catalá Galego Euskera Valenciano Enter in the next section the trusted domains for the application Save Enter one or more trusted domains Saved changes Changes have been saved correctly. Expired certificate Certificate close to expire The selected certificate is about to expire. Contact the issuing authority to renew it. The certificate is invalid as it is expired. Certificate of pseudonym The chosen certificate is a pseudonym certificate. Your personal data will not appear in the firm. Change certificate Enter a valid CAN Enter a valid pin Certificate added The certificate was successfully added History of signatures Loading certificate Loading certificates Signing Local %1$s of file %2$s Web %1$s requested by %2$s %1$s web of file %2$s %1$s web requested by %2$s of file %3$s %1$s requested by %2$s %1$s requested by another app of file %2$s %1$s requested by %2$s of file %3$s Batch signature requested by %s Web batch signature requested by %s Sign Cosign Countersign No records found Page %1$s of %2$s Signed by $$SUBJECTCN$$ on $$SIGNDATE=dd/MM/yyyy$$ with a certificate issued by $$ISSUERCN$$ Signed by $$PSEUDONYM$$ - $$OUS$$ on $$SIGNDATE=dd/MM/yyyy$$ Visible signature too small The area selected to display the signature is too small in size. Select a sign area Reselect an area Unselected area No area has been selected where to make the visible signature. Web %s %s requested by another app Enable DNIe usage by NFC Autofirma App allows you to sign via electronic ID via NFC. If your device has an NFC connection, you can enable signing with DNIe by activating the NFC connection of the device and the option \'Allow signing with DNIe by NFC\' in the section \'Signing Settings\'. Once active, you will be allowed to select if you want to sign with electronic certificate or electronic ID. How to make visible signature Autofirma App allows you to make visible signature of PDF documents you have on your device, in which the owner and issuer of the certificate and the date and time of signature will appear. You can enable the visible signature by activating the option \'Make visible signature\' in the section \'Signature settings\'. If you do not want your DNI/NIE to be visible in the signature text, you can hide it partially by activating the option \'Ofuscar user identifiers of the visible signatures\' certificates.> During the signing of the document you will be shown a miniature of it and controls that will allow you to browse between your pages and select the position in which you want to include the signature. Select the area to position the signature and press \'Continue\' to sign the document. How to set trusted domains If you need to process on a web with a domain that does not use an SSL certificate on which Android trusts, you can add this domain to the list of secure domains of the application from the \'Trusted domains\' section. In this section you can compose the list of domains you consider safe, for which you do not need to validate the SSL certificate. Add the different domains separated by commas (\',\') and using a wildcard (\'*\') at the beginning or end of the name if needed. In this section you could also deactivate the validation of the SSL certificate for all domains by deactivating the option \'Validate SSL connections\'. It is not safe to fully deactivate the validation of the connection certificates, so it should be avoided whenever possible. Go to configuration\u00A0 Autofirma App uses Android key store certificates to sign. You can install a new certificate by directly opening the .p12 or .pfx file with the certificate keys and entering your password. You can also select that same file via the option \'Add new certificate\' from the main screen of Autofirma App. The newly installed certificate will already be available on your device and you will be able to use it from Autofirma App to sign. If you don\'t find the key file on your mobile, you can send it from another device via email or other cloud applications. Import a certificate\u00A0 We\'ve tried to process your request, but it hasn\'t been completed successfully. Please check the documentation.
